channel.title: Notes of a Dabbler
channel.description: Recent content on Notes of a Dabbler

item.title: Keeping up with Tidverse Functions using Tidy Tuesday Screencasts
item.description: David Robinson has done several screencasts where he analyzes a Tidy Tuesday dataset live. I have listened to a few of them and found them very interesting and instructive. As I don’t use R on a daily basis, I have not kept up with what the latest is in Tidyverse. So when I listened to his screencasts, I learnt functions that I was not aware of. Since I sometimes forget which function I learnt, I wanted to extract all the functions used in the screencasts so that it is easier for me to refer to the ones that I am not aware of but should learn.

item.title: Fastai Collaborative Filtering with R and Reticulate
item.description: Jeremy Howard and Rachel Thomas are founders of fast.ai whose aim is to make deep learning accessible to all. They offer a course called Practical Deep Learning for Coders (Part 1). The last session, taught by Jeremy, was in Fall 2017 and the videos were released early January 2018. Their approach is top down by showing different applications first as black boxes followed by progressive peeling of the black box to teach the details of how things work.

item.title: Exploring Instacart Data with PCA
item.description: Recently, Instacart released a dataset of ~3 million orders made by ~200,000 users at different days of week and times of day. There is also an ongoing Kaggle competition to predict which products a user will buy again. My goal here is more modest where I just wanted to explore the dataset to find patterns of purchasing behaviour by hour of day, day of week and number of days since prior order.

item.title: My First Blogdown Post
item.description: Since I have been hearing a lot about virtues of Blogdown in various forums, I thought I will also give it a shot. I am planning to do my future blog posts in blogdown. I used to have my older site in Wordpress. But I don’t have plans at least in the near term to migrate the older content. (function() { var d = document, s = d.createElement('script'); s.

item.title: About
item.description: This blog is to catalog my learnings from others in topics related to R, Julia, Python, math, computations and visualizations. My older posts are in a blog in wordpress site. All views expressed here are my own and not representing anybody else (individual or company). Shankar Vaidyaraman
